    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Activity activity)
        Initialize the input mapper to listen for controller input. Should only be called once
        Parameters:
        activity - The context in which we're operating.

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown(android.app.Activity activity)
        Shutdown the input mapper before exiting.
        Parameters:
        activity - The context in which we're operating.

      • setEnableControllerDispatch

        public static void setEnableControllerDispatch(boolean enabled)
        OuyaController will be dispatched keyEvents and motionEvents to keep track of state. On by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Passing false will turn off dispatching input to the OuyaController

      • shouldHandleInputEvent

        public static boolean shouldHandleInputEvent(android.view.InputEvent event)
        Checks if the specified event should be passed into the OuyaInputMapper. If this returns false, don't pass the event into dispatchGenericMotionEvent or dispatchKeyEvent, instead have the activity delegate to it's super. Like so: 
        public boolean dispatchGenericMotionEvent(MotionEvent motionEvent) {
     if (OuyaInputMapper.shouldHandleInputEvent()) {
       return OuyaInputMapper.dispatchGenericMotionEvent(this, motionEvent);
     } else {
       return super.dispatchGenericMotionEvent(motionEvent);
     }
   }
        Parameters:
        event - the input event in question
        Returns:
        true if this event should be passed into OuyaInputMapper

      • dispatchGenericMotionEvent

        public static boolean dispatchGenericMotionEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                                 android.view.MotionEvent motionEvent)
        Dispatched MotionEvents will be remapped as if the input is an OuyaController. Input for unsupported controllers will pass to the activity onGenericMotionEvent. Handled input will be remapped to onGenericMotionEvent, onKeyDown, and onKeyUp on the activity. Avoid use of the KeyEvents that are sent to this method as they have not been remapped. Use the remapped input from the above events.
        Parameters:
        activity - The context in which we're operating.
        motionEvent - the original motionEvent from the activity.

      • dispatchKeyEvent

        public static boolean dispatchKeyEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                       android.view.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Dispatched KeyEvents will be remapped as if the input is an OuyaController. Input for unsupported controllers will pass to the activity onKeyDown and onKeyUp. Handled input will be remapped to onGenericMotionEvent, onKeyDown, and onKeyUp on the activity. Avoid use of the KeyEvents that are sent to this method as they have not been remapped. Use the remapped input from the above events.
        Parameters:
        activity - The context in which we're operating.
        keyEvent - the original motionEvent from the activity.
